DOC.brief_summary: The aim study determine whether High Flow nasal cannula ( HFNC ) oxygen efficient standard High Flow face mask ( HFFM ) preoxygenation orotracheal intubation crash induction non severely hypoxemic patient
DOC.brief_title: Benefits High Flow Nasal Cannula Oxygen Preoxygenation During Intubation Non Severely Hypoxemic Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This study design follow : patient randomize 2 group : High Flow nasal cannula `` HFNC '' standard High Flow face mask `` HFFM '' . Patients randomize `` HFNC '' group receive four minute preoxygenation period Nasal High Flow Therapy ( 60 L/mn , fraction inspire oxygen ( FI02 ) = 100 % ) orotracheal intubation laryngoscopy crash induction . After induction laryngoscopy , HFNC maintain attempt achieve apneic oxygenation . Patients randomize `` HFFM '' group receive four minute preoxygenation period standard face mask ( 15 L/mn ) orotracheal intubation laryngoscopy crash induction . After induction , HFFM remove , enable laryngoscopic vision
DOC.criteria: Adults older 18 year regardless gender Requiring orotracheal intubation intensive care unit `` No severely hypoxemic respiratory failure '' define Oxygen Pression ( Pa02 ) /FI02 > 200 mmHg measure 4 hour inclusion Not first Intubation stay intensive care unit Contraindication orotracheal intubation Intubation without anaesthesic rapid sequence induction Intubation cardiac arrest Real emergency ( asphyxia ) immediate intubation need ( without time enough randomization ) Nasopharyngeal obstacle contraindication use Optiflow device Patients document Cormack IV exposition inclusion Protected adult Pregnancy breastfeed Lack consent Patient already enrol another study could interfere primary objective study
